meanings.sent1: I saw him smoking a ciggy outside the store.
meanings.sent2: She always carries a pack of ciggies in her purse.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ciggy cross the road? To get smoked on the other side!
meanings.sent4: The glowing end of the ciggy looked like a tiny firefly in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The smell of a fresh ciggy can be quite enticing to some people.

meanings.definition: A small, cylindrical roll of finely cut tobacco for smoking.
meanings.sent1: He rolled his own ciggy using premium tobacco.
meanings.sent2: The old man offered me a hand-rolled ciggy from his tin.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse tried to drag the oversized ciggy back to its hole.
meanings.sent4: The smoke from the ciggy curled like a lazy snake in the air.
meanings.sent5: The ciggy in his hand was a symbol of relaxation after a long day.
